com.mpagliaro98.mysubscriptions.ui.interfaces

Interface SavedStateCompatible

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    FragmentAnalytics, FragmentCalendar, FragmentHome

    public interface SavedStateCompatible
    An interface to denote pages that are compatible with saved state bundles. A saved state compatible page will have functionality to fill a given bundle with the saved state it has, then apply that state from the bundle back to its view.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void applySavedState(android.os.Bundle savedState, android.view.View root)
      Given a bundle of saved state, extract the values that were saved to it previously and re-apply them to this view.
      void fillBundleWithSavedState(android.os.Bundle bundle)
      Populate a given bundle with values pertaining to how this fragment is set.

    • Method Detail

      • fillBundleWithSavedState

        void fillBundleWithSavedState(android.os.Bundle bundle)
        Populate a given bundle with values pertaining to how this fragment is set. These values should be indexed by static keys defined in the classes where this is implemented.
        Parameters:
        bundle - the bundle to place the saved items in

      • applySavedState

        void applySavedState(@NonNull
                     android.os.Bundle savedState,
                     android.view.View root)
        Given a bundle of saved state, extract the values that were saved to it previously and re-apply them to this view. This is best done with a series of if statements, checking that each needed key is in the bundle before applying it, as the bundle will likely have more than just the given view's saved state in it.
        Parameters:
        savedState - bundle of saved state, must not be null
        root - the root view of this tab
